2015/KER/209
P.UBAID, J.
Cri. M.C No. 7 of 2015
Dated this the 6" day of January, 2015.
ORDER

The petitioner herein is the sole accused in C.C No.254/2013
of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Malappuram. Crime in
the case was registered under Sections 341, 323, 324 and 506(i)
IPC on the complaint of one Anwar Sadath. He is the second
respondent in this proceeding. The petitioner seeks orders quashing
the prosecution on the ground that he and Anwar Sadath have come
to terms amicably out of court. The de facto complainant Anwar
Sadath has filed affidavit to the effect that he has settled the
dispute with the accused, and he has no grievance or complaint. I
find that the parties have really come to terms amicably, and
continuance of prosecution in such a situation will not serve any
purpose, other than wasting the precious time of the court.

In the result, this petition is allowed. The prosecution against
the petitioner in C.C No.254/2013 of the Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court, Malappuram will stand quashed under Section 482

Cr.P.C. Accordingly, he will stand released from prosecution,
and the bail bond, if any, executed by him will stand
discharged.
P.UBAID,
JUDGE
